title: Linux mkdosfs Command with Practical Examples
description: Learn how to use the mkdosfs command to create a DOS filesystem on a partition or format a USB drive. This lab covers the basics of the mkdosfs command and provides practical examples.

meta.title: Linux mkdosfs Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Learn how to use the mkdosfs command to create a DOS filesystem on a partition or format a USB drive. This lab covers the basics of the mkdosfs command and provides practical examples.
meta.keywords: Linux, mkdosfs, DOS filesystem, USB drive, partition, formatting

verify.name: Verify the DOS filesystem was created
verify.hint: The `file` command should identify the device as a "DOS/MBR boot sector", indicating that the DOS filesystem was created successfully.

steps.title: Creating a DOS Filesystem on a Partition

verify.name: Verify the DOS filesystem was created
verify.hint: The `file` command should identify the device as a "DOS/MBR boot sector", indicating that the DOS filesystem was created successfully.

steps.title: Formatting a USB Drive with DOS Filesystem

verify.name: Verify the USB drive was formatted with a DOS filesystem
verify.hint: The `file` command should identify the device as a "DOS/MBR boot sector", indicating that the USB drive was formatted with a DOS filesystem.
